INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description
2

(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Allegation On 12/01/22, youth was in seclusion after biting a staff member. A staff
member bent youth's left elbow back, dislocated youth's arm, and there
was a cracking noise.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was left phone messages on 12/9/22 and 12/12/22 to
inquire about allegations but did not return the phone calls.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
14, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
while in the recreation pod, she punched a peer in the face, so Staff 1
initiated a standing primary restraint then Supervisor took over the
restraint. Youth A stated her arms were behind her and Supervisor’s
arms were up and over her biceps. Youth A described Supervisor told
her they were going to walk to her room while Staff 1 and Staff 2
followed them. Youth A stated she was still in the restraint walking in
front of Supervisor on the way to her room. Youth A reported
Supervisor would not let her go so she tripped Supervisor by wrapping
her leg around his leg. Youth A described Supervisor and herself falling
to the ground, landing on her face, and cutting her lip. Youth A denied
any other injuries from falling. Youth A stated Supervisor continued to
have her in the restraint, and they got back up and walked to her room.
Youth A reported Supervisor continued the standing restraint while Staff
1 and Staff 2 cleared her room of her bedding and belongings. Youth A
stated while standing outside her room she was screaming and fighting
the restraint, so Supervisor walked her into her room. Youth A
described fighting the restraint, moving around a lot, and the restraint
moving to the ground. Youth A reported she was on her back, kicking
staff, biting, spitting, screaming, and telling staff to get their hands off
her. Youth A stated she grabbed a flashlight that fell from Staff 2’s
pocket and was trying to hit staff. Youth A reported she bit Supervisor
in the leg breaking the skin, bit Staff 1, Staff 2, and kicked Supervisor in
the face giving him a concussion. Youth A stated she could see
Supervisor was getting dizzy, so she stopped kicking. Youth A reported
Supervisor was telling her to stop but she was holding his shirt while he
was standing over her. Youth A stated Staff 2 was sitting by her head
and was holding one of her arms, Staff 1 was trying to hold her legs
and Supervisor was next to her. Youth A reported she doesn’t know
4

how her shoulder or elbow got hurt but believes Supervisor twisted her
arm while they were in her room on the floor, and she heard a popping
noise. During the interview Youth A moved her elbow and DHHS
Worker and I heard a popping noise. Youth A stated her elbow has
made that noise for a “long time,” even prior to the restraint. Youth A
stated a med slip was filled out and she saw the nurse on Thursday
when the nurse was at the facility. Youth A reported she saw the nurse
and the following day she went for x-rays. Youth A stated staff gave her
ice for her elbow and knee after the restraint. Youth A described
herself as being “too physical” during restraints.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 14, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 had Youth A in an escort hold in the rec pod for
punching her peer. Supervisor stated he took over the hold to walk
Youth A to her room. Supervisor described the hold as a standard
primary restraint technique, PRT, with arms in back. Supervisor stated
Youth A tripped them while walking to her room. Supervisor described
Youth A and himself falling sideways and landing on their left sides.
Supervisor stated Youth A and him got up and kept walking to her room
while Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed. Supervisor reported he continued to
hold Youth A outside her bedroom while Staff 1 and Staff 2 emptied
Youth A’s room. Supervisor stated he moved Youth A into her room,
and she started to fight staff. Supervisor described Youth A going to
the ground, laying on her back scratching staff, biting staff, punching,
screaming, and kicking him in the face causing him to have blurred
vision. Supervisor stated he walked out of the room for a few seconds
because he felt dizzy and had blurred vision. Supervisor stated he
walked back into the room to help Staff 1 and Staff 2 get out of the
room. Supervisor stated he does not recall much after coming back
into the room other than he knew he needed to help Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Supervisor denies bending Youth A’s elbow back or doing anything to
cause pain in Youth A’s shoulder. Supervisor denies hearing any
cracking noise come from Youth A’s elbow/arm area. Supervisor
denies having any concerns with how Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
positioned next to Youth A while on the ground. Supervisor denied
seeing any blood on Youth A’s lip from falling in the hallway.
Supervisor stated he left the facility after the restraint for a CT scan
where he was diagnosed with a concussion and received antibiotics for
Youth A biting him. Supervisor was interviewed again via telephone
on January 3, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
stated he did not recall much after getting kicked in the face by Youth
A. Supervisor stated he does not remember his knee making contact
with Youth A’s left side when he re-entered the room to help Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Supervisor stated everything was kind of a “blur and mushy”
after getting kicked in the face.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 14,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described Youth A
making physical contact with another youth, so he placed Youth A in a
PRT. Staff 1 stated Supervisor took over the restraint, continuing the
same hold and arm position, and walked Youth A to her room while
Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed. Staff 1 reported Youth A wrapped her legs
around Supervisor’s legs tripping Supervisor. Staff 1 stated he could
not recall how Youth A and Supervisor landed but Supervisor was able
to maintain the PRT hold. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Supervisor got
up and continued to Youth A’s room. Staff 1 described Supervisor
having Youth A up against the wall outside of Youth A’s room as Staff 1
and Staff 2 cleared Youth A’s room. Staff 1 stated once Youth A’s
room was clear, Supervisor walked Youth A into the room and Youth A
started to fight. Staff 1 described Youth A on her back on the floor and
kicking at Supervisor. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 was up by Youth A’s head,
Supervisor was trying to hold Youth A’s legs and got kicked in the face,
so Staff 1 went to take over holding Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 reported
Youth A bit Staff 2 in the forearm, Staff 1 got bit in his lower calf
muscle, and Supervisor also got bit. Staff 1 stated after Supervisor got
kicked, he moved up to the right side of Youth A’s body as she
continued to kick, punch and grab at staff. Staff 1 denied seeing
Supervisor do anything that would hurt Youth A’s elbow or hearing her
elbow/arm making any cracking noise. Staff 1 stated Youth A screams
very loud during any restraint. Staff 1 reported about an hour to hour
and a half after the restraint Youth A reported her arm hurt. Staff 1
stated he thought it might have been from the fall. Staff 1 denied
seeing Youth A have a bloody lip at any time during the restraint or
after the fall. Staff 1 stated Youth A never said anything to him about a
bloody lip. Staff 1 stated he did not have any concerns with the
restraint.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 14,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported seeing
Youth A after the restraint to check Youth A’s elbow. Nurse stated
Youth A had a small abrasion on her shoulder and had full range of
motion. Nurse reported she ordered x-rays, and the x-rays showed no
fracture. Nurse stated Youth A has not complained of shoulder pain
since the initial visit. Nurse denied ever hearing Youth A’s
elbow/shoulder make a cracking noise.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 19, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described Supervisor
having Youth A in a PRT in the hallway outside Youth A’s room as Staff
1 and Staff 2 cleared the room. Staff 2 reported Supervisor brought
Youth A into the room and Youth A began fighting. Staff 2 described
4

Youth A as, “hard to hold and bendy, like wresting a bag oh cats.” Staff
2 stated Youth A’s arm came loose from Supervisor, and she went to
the floor. Staff 2 stated while on the floor, Youth A was laying on her
back kicking like crazy, biting staff and screaming. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor had one of Youth A’s arms, Staff 2 had an arm and Staff 1
was holding Youth A’s legs. Staff 2 denied seeing Supervisor bend
Youth A’s elbow back or hearing a cracking noise. Staff 2 denied
seeing Supervisor’s knee make contact with the left side of Youth A’s
body. Staff 2 stated he was focused on holding Youth A’s arm and
getting her calm enough so staff could exit the room. Staff 2 stated the
PRT was “spot on” and did not see anything from Supervisor or Staff 1
of concern. Staff 2 reported he did checks on Youth A that night and
Youth A did not mention her arm hurting. Staff 2 denied seeing any
blood on Youth A’s lip or Youth A mentioning she had a bloody lip.
DHHS Worker has no findings for this investigation.
Video Review:
Video footage of the restraint on 12/01/22 of Youth A was
reviewed.
• Video is consistent with Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2’s
interviews. Video shows Youth A wrap her leg around
Supervisor’s leg causing them to fall in the hallway. It does not
appear Youth A lands on her face but more on her left side.
After Supervisor is kicked in the face by Youth A, he is seen
walking out of the room for a few seconds, stand in the doorway
and then walk back into the room. Youth A is laying on her back
trying to kick, wiggling around on the floor, punching the air with
her arms and screaming. The video shows Staff 1 holding Youth
A’s legs as she is continuing to kick and Staff 2 is up by Youth
A’s head. It is unclear if Staff 2 is successfully holding either of
Youth A’s arms. Supervisor is standing in a hunched position to
the side of Youth A over the middle of Youth A’s body. Youth A
is moving her arms. The video shows Supervisor go down to the
floor on his knee making contact with Youth A’s left side. On the
video the sound of Youth A’s scream changes in tone. It is
unclear if Supervisor lost his balance after coming back into the
room after getting kicked in the head or if Youth A pulled him to
the ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Supervisor completed the required Handle with Care training on
05/25/22 and became an instructor on 10/24/22.
4

• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Staff 1 completed the required Handle with Care training on
07/26/22.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was one written reprimand from
02/24/21 for inappropriate language. Staff 2 completed the
required Handle with Care on 03/24/22.
• Incident Report 145250201 which was consistent with
Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A’s interviews.
• Bay Pines Center Post Restraint med slip dated 12/02/2022:
Nurse notes sore left elbow, abrasion left shoulder from restraint.
• OSF Health Care Office Visit report dated 12/08/2022: X-rays
order of the left elbow.
• OSF Health Care X-Ray Report for Youth A dated 12/09/2022:
No acute osseous abnormality.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as interviews with Youth A,
Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, and video review do not indicate or show
how Youth A’s elbow was injured. The video does not show Supervisor
bending Youth A’s elbow back. The video shows the PRT being
properly performed by Staff 1 and Supervisor. The video does show
Supervisor’s knee make contact with Youth A’s left side when
Supervisor goes to the floor. It is unclear in video if Supervisor is
knocked off balance by Youth A or if his balance is off due from just
being kicked in the face by Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a)Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Allegation Youth has pain in their knee due to a past surgery. They are
concerned that the pins have shifted, and the medical treatment being
offered at the facility is not helping.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
14, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described her
knee as being “kinda bad” and having ACL surgery on 07/25/22. Youth
A reported she has screws and pins in her knee, and it has not healed
correctly. Youth A stated after her knee surgery she started “messing
my ACL up because I wanted to hurt myself.” Youth A described hitting
herself with her crutches, hitting others with the crutches so she had to
be restrained, and breaking the knee brace. Youth A reported she
completed physical therapy but due to her knee still hurting she went
back to the doctor and is going to begin physical therapy again in
4

January. Youth A stated she tells the nurse at the facility that her knee
hurts and is told they cannot do anything. Youth A stated she is given
ice and ibuprofen for the pain. Youth A reported Supervisor told her he
would look into getting her a wheelchair.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 14, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported Youth A complains frequently of knee plain since having ACL
surgery. Supervisor stated the nurse has examined Youth A and Youth
A has been to physical therapy. Supervisor stated Youth A is given ice
and ibuprofen when her knee is hurting.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 14,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
complains about her knee quiet often. Staff 1 stated Youth A had
surgery on her knee in August or September 2022 and she did not
follow the treatment plan for her knee. Staff 1 reported Youth A would
use her crutches as weapons. Staff 1 stated Youth A is offered
medicine when her knee is hurting but she will refuse it and will not
follow through with the doctor’s orders. Staff 1 reported med slips are
completed when Youth A is complaining about her knee and an
appointment is made with the nurse.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 14,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported Youth A
has reported her knee hurts all the time. Nurse stated Youth A was
non-compliant with care after having ACL surgery. Nurse described
Youth A using her crutches and knee brace as weapons. Nurse stated
Youth A broke the first knee brace and was given a second brace.
Nurse stated an ice machine was placed in Youth A’s room after
surgery so she would always have ice to use. Nurse reported Youth A
took the cord for the ice machine and wrapped it around her neck, so
the ice machine had to be removed from her room. Nurse stated Youth
A did complete physical therapy but due to the pain continuing in the
knee Youth A was seen again by the surgeon. Nurse reported the
surgeon ordered more physical therapy, which will begin January 4,
2023. Nurse stated she has spoken with Youth A about the care of her
knee and the consequences when not following the care. Nurse stated
Youth A has been seen multiple times for the knee pain, given ice,
ibuprofen, and told to rest and elevate the leg. Nurse stated they are
doing all they can for Youth A’s knee pain.
DHHS Worker has no findings for this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
4

• OSF HealthCare Office Visit dated 10/27/2022: “She (Youth A)
had an ACL reconstruction on July 25, 2022. She did not wear
her brace as she should. She completed her physical therapy,
and her knee still hurts. She uses ice and ibuprofen occasionally
for comfort. She reports that it occasionally gives out on her.
There are well-healed incisions on the left knee.” Report
indicated it had only been 3 months since surgery and still some
healing going on, recommended follow up with orthopedic
surgeon if want more answers.
• Bay Pines Youth Center Nurse note dated 11/06/22: Youth A
complaining of knee pain, nurse examined at facility and
indicated, orthopedic appointment rescheduled to sooner date,
now 11/16 at 11:45am.
• OSF HealthCare Office Visit dated 11/17/2022: “She (Youth A)
was non-compliant with postoperative care and damaged her
knee brace and also used her crutches as a weapon. She has
been complaining of intermittent left knee pain. She did have a
scheduled follow-up with the orthopedic surgeon earlier this
week however due to her behavior and suicidal threats staff
determined it was not safe to take her. This appointment has
been rescheduled.” Report indicated, “Discussed with patient
that as she was non-compliant with postoperative which
instructions this likely impacted the healing of the knee. Follow-
up appointment made with orthopedics for further evaluation and
care.”
• Advanced Center for Orthopedics and Plastic Surgery Notes
dated 11/29/22: PT ordered again for 2-3 times/week for 4-6
weeks. Physical therapy will start again for Youth A 01/04/23.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A has been seen by
nursing staff at Bay Pines, medical professionals through OSF Health
Care as well as Advanced Center for Orthopedics. Youth A admits to
not following through with treatment for her knee after surgery.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

It is recommended based on Special Investigation 2022C0227015, 2022C0227016,

sir_summary.summary: A youth at Bay Pines Center was injured during a physical restraint, sustaining a dislocated arm and a cut lip, while staff suffered bites and a concussion. The investigation, including video review, found the restraint was properly performed and the injury could not be definitively attributed to staff misconduct, concluding no violation occurred. A separate allegation regarding inadequate medical treatment for the youth's knee pain was also not substantiated, as appropriate care was provided. Based on the evidence, the facility and its staff were not found culpable for the injuries sustained.
